results.title: My dad
results.creator_credit: Fan Chen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In China where they lived in rather poor conditions, Fan Chen’s father worked hard to support his family and provide a better life for them, eventually making the move to Australia in 2006. This story is a ‘thank you’ from his admiring son.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fan Chen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: L'Arrivee = The Arrival
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description:
‘L’Arrivee’ is Tscherkassky’s second homage to the Lumiere-brothers. First you see the arrival of the film itself, which shows the arrival of a train at a station. But that train collides with a second train, causing a violent crash, which leads us to an unexpected third arrival, the arrival of a beautiful woman, the happy-end.

Reduced to two minutes, ‘L’Arrivee’ gives a brief, but exact summary of what cinematography (after its arrival with Lumieres train) has made into an enduring presence of our visual environment: violence, emotions. Or, as an anonymous American housewife (cited by T. W. Adorno) used to describe Hollywood’s version of life: ‘Getting into trouble and out of it again.’

Or, as an anonymous American housewife (cited by T. W. Adorno) used to describe Hollywood’s version of life: ‘Getting into trouble and out of it again.’

results.brief_description: A social commentary on the environment in the year 3000 with a look back into the past and what used to be before the thoughtless destruction by humanity of the earth’s forests. 3-D computer animation with music soundtrack - no commentary.
